entry.title: Blind Faith
entry.summary:
Author: AxisMage

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 143,434Chapters: 23/?Kudos: 153

Summary: It's no one's fault but his own that Dick is sitting there now, cold and utterly miserable, and very close to freezing to death.It's no one's fault but his own that he let his heart and mind get away again. It's no one's fault but his own that he wanted for someone who couldn't and wouldn't be his, and Wally is right.Dick needs to get back to his life, start over and make new friends. That's all, nothing more and nothing less. Friends, Dick needs friends, and sadly (according to Wally), Krypto isn't enough.

entry.title: weep my sorry tongue
entry.summary:
Author: secondhandsun (forgetmesunflower)

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,967Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 73

Summary: “What about you, Red Hood?” The magician drew out each word as he asked, “Tell us: what is your deepest, darkest secret, the thing you’ve not told anyone else?”His mind narrowed in on itself. After Dick’s… admission, several things came to mind, but really, he knew what his mind would conjure up, what his mouth would form, and Dick’s confession made him feel all the more disgusting for what he was about to say. He’d never planned to act on it. Never. He’d planned to take it to his grave, twice over. And yet–───Jason, Dick, and Tim are forced to reveal what they’ve never told another soul. They deal with the fallout.

entry.title: Hunters in Gotham
entry.summary:
Author: WarriorWolf

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,066Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: When a cursed mission in Gotham erupts into chaos, Chaos, Red hood, Ghost, and their scattered family of hunters are hurled through a violent temporal rift. Instead of the Gotham they know, they land in 1960s London-a world of Cold War intrigue, shadow wars, and a young Alfred Pennyworth still carving out his legend. But Jason isn't empty-handed: he carries a mysterious letter, penned decades ahead of its time, that Alfred has apparently been waiting for. Pursued by enemies across eras and tangled in a plot that blurs magic, espionage, and fate itself, the hunters must survive a city of spies while protecting a man who will one day help shape the Dark Knight's future. In a game where Chuck rewrites the rules of time, every move could alter the past-and shatter the future.

entry.title: Transference
entry.summary:
Author: murphy_stoffelis

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 56,364Chapters: 12/16Kudos: 131

Summary: A violent blight is sweeping through Gotham. Innocent people are suddenly being consumed by rage— with disastrous consequences. With no cure in sight, Jason finds himself working with Batman to save the city from madness.Even with his resurrection a thing of the past, an alliance with the Bats is a harrowing line between reconnecting with a former life and preserving the Red Hood's hard-won autonomy— especially when Jason's partnership with Dick Grayson begins to rekindle a past they've both tried to bury.Because in a city like Gotham, you can't trust who you love. Not even family.

entry.title: putting down roots
entry.summary:
Author: mikaminato

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,932Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 208

Summary: "Is Jason alive?" Bruce whispered once, in a voice he rarely used anymore. "Clark? Is he really here? With us?""Yeah." Clark kissed him on the forehead with such tenderness that Bruce wanted to die. "He's fine. His heart is beating strong. I can hear him, B. He's still out on patrol. Tim is eating a cheeseburger with Kon a couple blocks from the old theater on 6th Street. Dick... Dick's laughing at something Damian's telling him. They're all safe."That was the moment. That was the moment Bruce understood why no one would ever understand him as much as Clark did. He also realized no one could ever hold his brokenness and love him as Clark does, in silence and in the dark. (Or, Bruce is having a hard time accepting Dick and Jason's relationship, but not for the reasons one might expect.)

entry.title: Glass Rain
entry.summary:
Author: soaring_bubblegum

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 73,547Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 648

Summary: Jason Todd wakes up in the wrong Gotham.Here, he stayed dead. Here, his death broke his family so completely they became the monsters they once fought. Dick Grayson haunts the skyline with wings and talons, Barbara Gordon moves like a spider made of shadow, and something that might have once been Batman rules from a corrupted cave.The city is quarantined, the air tastes of ozone and old blood, and Jason should be running.Instead, he finds himself drawn to the creature that was once his brother—the one stalking him through twisted streets with eyes that still burn with something almost human.Some hunts, it turns out, go both ways.
